name: TFS4JIRA

marketplaceType.toolTip: Evaluate and purchase this add-on through your MyAtlassian account.

version.releaseNotes:
TFS4JIRA 5.2 is a very important release which brings a number of highly requested improvements. Specifically:

  • the commits are scanned in parts and most recent git changes are fetched first
  • we added a feature to fetch repository names to select them from the list during profile configuration
  • git scans are now performed by parallel threads
  • we have improved, simplified and optimized the UI in several places
  • we added an option to disable HTML to JIRA wiki markup conversion for descriptions, and other rich text fields
  • we have performed a massive code refactoring, removed older libraries and replaced them with modern solutions
  • we have migrated the solution to .NET 4.5 and refreshed the installer package

We have also resolved numerous bugs.

If you feel like sharing your opinions on using TFS4JIRA please send us an email to support@spartez.com. And if you like our product please do not hesitate to leave a review on Atlassian Marketplace.

Enjoy TFS4JIRA 5.2!

name: PDF View Plugin for JIRA (PDF Exporter)

marketplaceType.toolTip: Evaluate and purchase this add-on through your MyAtlassian account.

version.releaseNotes:
Scalability

We refactored the PDF document renderer from an everything-in-memory to a streaming architecture, resulting in drastic performance improvements. 25-50K issues can be exported to complex, tens-of-thousands-of-pages documents. We also updated the following document templates to scale better to large data sets (faster and using less memory):

  • issue-fo.vm
  • issue-navigator-fo.vm
  • gantt-chart-fo.vm
  • requirement-specification-fo.vm
  • story-card-fo.vm

Error tolerance

The robustness of the exported logic was vastly improved to deal with unexpected HTML and XML. It can handle unknown elements, unknown attributes, unknown CSS styling, and every sort of syntax errors. If you are maintaining or migrating field values in HTML, this will save you lots of headache.

Expressions Reference Manual

Want to export field X of object Y? Use this new template both as cheatsheet and as testing environment.

Bugfixes:

  • Front-end does not conflict with the Zendesk Connector add-on

name: SCM Activity for JIRA

version.releaseNotes:
This plugin separates SCM Change-Set data from JIRA, as a result it increases Issue loading performance by avoiding issue comments or change-set custom fields and less database growth. It loads SCM change-set data only on SCM Activity tab click.

- Easy maintenance and high availability of JIRA instance due to less database growth/size

- This plugin captures the results of the SCM change-sets in the JIRA issue Activity section. The Change-set details are not written to the JIRA comment section resulting in a cleaner, more efficiently performing JIRA system.

- This plugin provides JQL Search functions namely scmSearch() and scmActivitySearch() to search SCM activities by file name or author or branch or tag and change text message ..etc

- Easy to generate Release Notes, since this plugin provides REST Interface to post or fetch change-set details

- External jobs integration

- Supports multiple SCM systems

Bug fixes:

AMPS-1268: is broken in AMPS 6.0.4

AMPS-1285: Fecru, Confluence ITs test failed while running against JDK8

AMPS-1286: Skeleton plugins in platform 3 is still using old javax servlet artifact name

AMPSDEV-12: mvn test fails but mvn package works

AMPSDEV-104: Plugin's integration-test cannot be run in refapp

AMPSDEV-135: Oops No More *;resolution:=optional

AMPSDEV-150: Modify bitbucket-maven-plugin to ensure that the same version of jaxb-impl and jaxb-core are included as dependencies

AMPSDEV-151: Plugin packaged with AMPS 6.0.6 won't work in refapp (6.0.1 would)


Enhancement / Features:

AMPSDEV-2: Separate SDK release from Plugin release

AMPSDEV-58: atlas-create-*-plugin archetypes should create version 3 plugin (transformerless)

AMPSDEV-97: Refactor AMPS create-*-plugin to use spring-scanner

AMPSDEV-125: Using Jira test data for restore dump file

AMPSDEV-142: Deliver QuickReload to AMPS

AMPSDEV-155: Add product and container version mapping

AMPSDEV-159: Update 6.1.x of AMPS to include new versions of fastdev and devtoolbox that work with Bitbbucket Server 4.0

compatibleApplications.introduction: Confluence is the perfect tool for getting everyone on the same page. Create stunning visuals to explain your ideas, theme Confluence into a thing of beauty, or take advantage of powerful tools for technical writers. Whether your team is large or small, technical or Luddite, there's a Confluence add-on to get everyone in sync.

compatibleApplications.name: FishEye/Crucible
compatibleApplications.introduction: Code review means better code. And with Crucible, code review gets a whole lot easier. Add-ons for Crucible integrate it with your IDE and JIRA and provide powerful reporting and statistics. What are you waiting for? Stop reading this, start reviewing code.

compatibleApplications.name: Bamboo
compatibleApplications.introduction: Builds! Tests! Deploys! Oh my! With Bamboo, you're one step closer to the dream of continuous integration and deployment. Let the collection of Bamboo add-ons help you get on your way with advanced reporting and powerful integrations. No matter what configuration you have, there's a Bamboo add-on to make your build agents work even better for you.

compatibleApplications.introduction: Crowd is the single sign-on tool of your dreams. Grab users from LDAP, AD, Google Apps, or Open ID and plug them right into your Atlassian products. And add-ons for Crowd add even more power, like tighter integration with LDAP and sweet CLI interfaces. Crowd brings everyone in and puts you in control.

name: Commit Policy Plugin for JIRA (Git, SVN)

marketplaceType.toolTip: Evaluate and purchase this add-on through your MyAtlassian account.

version.releaseNotes:
Token-based authentication

This new authentication mode, based on security tokens instead of plain text passwords, greatly improves hook security.

Git client-side verifications (commit-msg hook)

Reject broken commits before those are actually made! This mechanism verifies the commits in the developers' clone at commit time.

Support for Bitbucket Cloud & GitHub

Verify commits locally even if the remote repository is hosted in a closed system, where you cannot configure hooks.

Hook Script Wizard

The redesigned interface makes hook script installation a breeze.

"$committer.userName" variable

This variable in JQL conditions will be replaced with the committer's username before the JQL search is executed. Example JQL: "assignee = $committer.username"

Improvements

  • Execute permission "x" is auto-set for hook script files (on U*X)

Bugfixes

  • VisualSVN permission problems fixed
  • All condition types obey file path based scope limiting
  • International character fixes on Windows (files and usernames)

name: Catch-to-JIRA Workflow Extension

marketplaceType.toolTip: Evaluate and purchase this add-on through the vendor's website.

version.releaseNotes: JIRA is the business when it comes to requirements capture and defect management. With the Catch-to-JIRA Workflow Extension, Enterprise Tester supports full bi-directional synchronization of JIRA requirements/user stories and issues.The Catch-to-JIRA Workflow Extension accelerates the utility of an already pretty snazzy API and native capability to allow: configurable import filtering by type, status, priorities, JQL fragments, components, affected version(s), fix version(s); optional sub-task synchronization; configurable synchronization schedules â adhoc (manual), periodic (set time interval) and daily; custom field support; JIRA ID on the requirement in Enterprise Tester; remote links to the Requirement in Enterprise Tester (and test script when linked) added on the JIRA User Story, and; JIRA workflow transition support from Enterprise Tester.

name: Gallifrey

version.releaseNotes:
Features:

  • When adding locked timers, prompts if you want to add to running timer
  • Added link to Gitter for chat help
  • Added Copy/Paste functionality to timers to get jira ref and add new timer with same ref
  • Updated some keyboard shortcuts
  • Show all dates even if no timers for that date
  • Added temporary timers for logging purpose when you don't have a Jira reference to hand
  • Ability to add lock time to an existing timer or recent reference
  • Added bulk export when clicking unexported time notice or multi selecting timers
  • Ability to add export comments as a standard comment as well as worklog comment

Bug Fixes

  • Fix issue for exported timers resetting to un-exported
  • Round locked timers to nearest minute as seconds are not logged anyway
  • Updated the order of default search results
  • Fixed issue with getting an idle timer after it's auto purged
  • Fixed issue with changing timer date when running
  • Auto update check now doesn't run when a flyout is open
  • Keyboard shortcuts only active when flyout not open

instructions.body: Installer is "Click-Once" so should install and update itself.

name: StopWatch for JIRA

version.releaseNotes:
Important improvement:

Previous versions of Jira StopWatch fetches the filter-list and issue-list once every 30 seconds. It came to my attention, that this could overload the Jira servers if many people are using StopWatch.

From this version forward, both the filter-list and issue-list will only be fetched on-demand, ie. when the dropdown boxes are actually opened.

name: Risk Register

marketplaceType.toolTip: Evaluate and purchase this add-on through your MyAtlassian account.

version.releaseNotes:
Bug fixes in version 3.0.1:

  • Fixed: exposure not appearing in JIRA Issues gadget in Confluence
  • Fixed: risk issue type mistakenly added to default issue type scheme
  • Fixed: project picker includes projects that already have a risk register
  • Fixed: project picker spins endlessly if there are no projects

(Version 3.0.0) Makes risk management easier for organizations that have finer-grained risk models. It also integrates risks more seamlessly into the Issue Navigator.

New features:

  • Changing the risk model: make your matrix 4x4, 5x5, 3x6, or any dimensions you like.
  • Use Exposure as a term in your issue search filters, and get risk statistics by Exposure.
  • Manifest: a diagnostic tool that shows behind-the-scenes configuration data

instructions.body: For MacOSX its quite easy. Download the DMG, double click it and drag the WT4 icon to the "Applications" folder. * App can be run from Spotlight by typing "WT4" * Using "Launchpad" and clicking on the "WT4" * Using "Finder": Go to "Applications" > "WT4"

For windows there are a bit more steps. Download EXE file, double click it to run the installer. There may be additional windows that you may be asked if you want to run the installer. Simply click "Run", or "Yes". When the installation window runs, click "Install" to begin installation.    After installation completes. App can be run: * There should be a shortcut in the desktop with "WT4" title * Typing "WT4" in search bar when pressing "Start"

name: R4J - Requirements Management for JIRA

marketplaceType.toolTip: Evaluate and purchase this add-on through your MyAtlassian account.

version.releaseNotes:
The coverage view has been reworked to include more information and to be more flexible. In addition to the previous configuration options, you can now define your own filter using Atlassian's JQL language and define custom labels for each column.

We have added the option to use JQL to define custom filters for both the traceability matrix as well as the "add existing issue" dialog. Be more efficient by creating filters on demand!

In addition, you can now change the link type of an issue link so you don't need to delete and re-create a link anymore!

Last but not least there is a lot of fine-tuning in the back-end to give you an improved experience with Requirements for JIRA.

Ephor Asset Manager for JIRA version 1.3.2 comes with a new icon, new color scheme and updated asset screens in demo data.

Improved import from CSV file comes with better support of Excel 2013 files and with a nice new progress indicator.

We also decided to make it easier to evaluate Ephor for longer and purchase it. Based on the feedback we have received from evaluators and customers we decided to change the pricing structure of the product, so that it is representing the needs of companies of different sizes better. And the lowest tier is not limited with data size any more. Give it a try!

Last but not least we have also updated REST API and removed several bugs in the add-on.

We are always happy to hear opinions and comments from our customers. Do you have one? Leave a review on Atlassian Marketplace!

name: Time Tracker for JIRAÂ®

marketplaceType.toolTip: Evaluate and purchase this add-on through the vendor's website.

version.releaseNotes:
An OS X status bar app to track and log the time spent on JIRAÂ® issues

  • Synchronise Issues
  • Easy Tracking
  • Issue Search
  • Filters
  • Comments
  • Awesome blur background

Works with any JIRAÂ® installation, local or cloud.

instructions.body: Get the app from the App Store.    https://itunes.apple.com/at/app/time-tracker-for-jira/id1006622085?l=en&mt=12

Start the app. From the status bar menu, choose "JIRA Account..." and fill your login credentials.    Make sure, that in your installation, the 'Allow Remote API Calls' is turned ON under Administration > General Configuration.
From the status bar menu, choose the "Update Projects".    You are done. Start the counter and submit your time.

version.releaseNotes:
IMPROVEMENTS

  • Added JIRA 7.1 compatibility.

SECURITY UPDATES

  • Corrected a critical-rated remote code execution vulnerability.

FIXES

  • Fixed an issue preventing drill-through to the Issue Navigator from Dataplane dashboard gadgets under certain conditions.
  • Fixed issues in JIRA 6.x instances for users whose username (login) had been renamed.
  • The PDF export of entire JIRA dashboards sometimes omitted the titles of certain reports.
  • Removed excessive space between plotted series bars when a grouped bar or grouped column chart is selected for Chart Type.

See the FULL RELEASE NOTES for complete details.

name: Excel Automation Plugin for JIRA (XLSX)

version.releaseNotes:
New action: "Attach Excel"

This new automation action allows generating Excel spreadsheets periodically or by triggered by issue events (created, updated, transitioned, work logged, etc.) and then attaching the resulted file to a JIRA issue. The target issue can be the one which triggered the automation, or another one selected by a JQL query!

Support for Data Center

This realease fully supports JIRA Data Center, enabling automation in clustered JIRA deployments.

More robust installation

Previous add-on versions may have had class-loading issues right after installation or version update. This release comes with rewamped OSGi dependency management, to prevent those issues.

name: TMetric - time tracker for Jira

version.releaseNotes:
Workflow Timeline

Timeline is a visual representation of your workflow. It helps you go back to every minute of your work day and see the sites or programs that you viewed. You can edit your work time using only a mouse.

Quick Task Switching

Frequent switch between tasks is a bad practice, but it happens. TMertic is well-suited for such situations and makes the switching effortless.

Simple Reports

The reports are simple but customizable. Add variuos filters to view time for projects, teams, or individuals. Use sorting to configure the report.

TMetric is FREE!

Create a TMetric account and start using the tool for FREE.

instructions.body: 1. Install TMetric browser extension. (Chrome Extension, FireFox Extension, Opera Extension) 2. Click the TMetric icon next to the browser address bar and log into your TMetric account. 3. Click the Start Timer button in your web app to start tracking time. 4. Thats all!

name: SAML 2.0 Single Sign-On for Jira

version.releaseNotes:
- Refactored the logic for creating a session for SSO user

- Fixed auto-create user option on Jira 7+

- Removed usage of deprecated UserUtil class

- Fixed missing "Use Corporate Login" button on Jira 7+

- Auto-created users are now added to a specific user group. The group used can be configured in the plugin config.

- Refactored SAMLConfig, SsoLoginServlet and SsoLogoutServlet logic into the common [atlassian-saml](https://github.com/bitium/atlassian-saml) project

- Plugin now redirects to the correct requested page after SSO. No longer defaulting to the dashboard.

instructions.body: Download zip archive.
Unpack zip archive to temporary folder.
Run Symproj\InstallUI.bat, follow instructions inside.
Go to directory where Symproj was installed, e.g.    C:\Symproj\Symproj\target\bin.
Run application with run_symproj_main.bat.
On first screen input your JIRA server URL and credentials.    If your JIRA server supports both HTTP and HTTPS, please use HTTPS in URL. HTTP may cause problems in some configurations.

name: Better Excel Plugin for JIRA (XLSX)

marketplaceType.toolTip: Evaluate and purchase this add-on through your MyAtlassian account.

version.releaseNotes:
Support for JIRA Data Center

In a clustered JIRA environment, all configuration including Excel templates, Groovy scripts and other resources are transparently replicated among the nodes by the add-on. When exporting, you can access any random node in the cluster to get your Excel spreadsheet. Therefore, the add-on fully supports JIRA enterprise deployments.

Support for JIRA 6.2 - 7.0

We extended the range of compatible JIRA versions to cover all modern JIRA versions.

Changes

  • MIME type is changed to the standard "application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet", in order not to confuse your browser.
  • If the actor's username is mistyped in an automation rule's configuration, the add-on reports it as WARN in the log.

compatibleApplications.introduction: Nice one! Your team went JIRA. You've got a best-in-class issue tracker, but that's only the beginning. The Marketplace is brimming with apps for time-tracking, agile project management, test management, and integration with your other systems. Add-ons are ready to help make JIRA the best project tracker you've ever used.

compatibleApplications.name: Confluence
compatibleApplications.introduction: Confluence is the perfect tool for getting everyone on the same page. Create stunning visuals to explain your ideas, theme Confluence into a thing of beauty, or take advantage of powerful tools for technical writers. Whether your team is large or small, technical or Luddite, there's a Confluence add-on to get everyone in sync.

compatibleApplications.name: Bamboo
compatibleApplications.introduction: Builds! Tests! Deploys! Oh my! With Bamboo, you're one step closer to the dream of continuous integration and deployment. Let the collection of Bamboo add-ons help you get on your way with advanced reporting and powerful integrations. No matter what configuration you have, there's a Bamboo add-on to make your build agents work even better for you.

compatibleApplications.name: Crowd
compatibleApplications.introduction: Crowd is the single sign-on tool of your dreams. Grab users from LDAP, AD, Google Apps, or Open ID and plug them right into your Atlassian products. And add-ons for Crowd add even more power, like tighter integration with LDAP and sweet CLI interfaces. Crowd brings everyone in and puts you in control.

version.releaseNotes:
• Easier configuration: the JAR sending results to JIRA does not expect the ID of the TestCase type anymore so less parameters are required to be specified
  • The parameter names have changed to make understanding their meaning easier
  • You can now optionally specify the names for the "Auto-Pass" and "Auto-Fail" transitions through the JAR's parameters
  • The JAR now talks directly to the TestFLO Automation plugin, it does not talk directly to JIRA API anymore

version.releaseNotes:

instructions.body: Download zip archive
Unpack
Run Symproj/InstallUI.bat, follow instructions
Go to directory where Symproj were installed, e.g.    C:\Symproj\Symproj\target\bin
start run_main.bat
Provide your JIRA server URL and credentials
In main menu select Worked - Worked

version.releaseNotes: The TestRail add-on is available for JIRA Server 5.x, 6.x and 7.x as well as JIRA Cloud. There are two different feature-equivalent editions/versions of the add-on for JIRA Server, one for JIRA 5.x/6.x and one for JIRA 7.x+. The new add-on update adds support for detecting the JIRA version and prevents installing the add-on with the incorrect JIRA version. It will also disable the add-on when updating JIRA from 5.x/6.x to JIRA version 7.x (which requires a different edition/version of the add-on).
